intro: Grindelia gymnospermoides, commonly known as the desert gumweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its yellowish-green flowers and hairy, silver-gray foliage. The plant is adapted to arid environments, with deep root systems that allow it to survive in dry, sandy soils. It produces small, wind-pollinated flowers that develop into fluffy, seed-filled capsules. Grindelia gymnospermoides is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small insects.
